meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the incorporation of oxygen into a substrate.
meanings.sent1: The oxygenases in our bodies help convert oxygen into useful substances.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study oxygenases to understand how oxygen is utilized in biological processes.
meanings.sent3: The oxygenases at work in the cells are like tiny oxygen chefs, cooking up important molecules.
meanings.sent4: In the chemical dance of life, oxygenases are the choreographers adding oxygen to the mix.
meanings.sent5: Imagine oxygenases as tiny oxygen artists, painting molecules with life-giving oxygen.

meanings.definition: Proteins that facilitate the transfer of oxygen atoms to a substrate.
meanings.sent1: Hemoglobin is a well-known example of proteins acting as oxygenases in the body.
meanings.sent2: During respiration, oxygenases play a crucial role in delivering oxygen to tissues.
meanings.sent3: The oxygenases in the blood are like diligent oxygen couriers, ensuring oxygen reaches its destination.
meanings.sent4: Like oxygen conductors, proteins functioning as oxygenases orchestrate the movement of oxygen atoms.
meanings.sent5: Proteins working as oxygenases are the oxygen carriers that keep our bodies energized and functioning well.

meanings.definition: Molecules that contain oxygen and act as catalysts in chemical reactions.
meanings.sent1: Certain medications contain oxygenases that speed up chemical processes in the body.
meanings.sent2: In laboratories, scientists use oxygenases to accelerate the production of specific compounds.
meanings.sent3: The oxygenases in the lab are like magical potion mixers, creating reactions with a touch of oxygen.
meanings.sent4: Just like oxygen-infused catalysts, oxygenases enhance the speed and efficiency of reactions.
meanings.sent5: Picture oxygenases as tiny chemical wizards, waving their oxygen wands to spark reactions and create new compounds.
